entry.title: The Advice and Assistance (Financial Conditions) (Scotland) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: This version of the The Advice and Assistance (Financial Conditions) (Scotland) Regulations 2004 is the published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer for Scotland. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Social Security (Intensive Activity Period 50 to 59 Pilot) Regulations 2004

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Social Security (Intensive Activity Period 50 to 59 Pilot) Regulations 2004

entry.summary: These Regulations establish a pilot scheme relating to persons who claim a jobseeker’s allowance and who fulfil the criteria specified in regulation 3 as to age, period over which they have been receiving benefit and the location of the appropriate offices at which they are claiming benefit, as identified in the Schedule to these Regulations.

title.div: The Education (Induction Arrangements for School Teachers) (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2004 / Rheoliadau Addysg (Trefniadau Ymsefydlu ar gyfer Athrawon Ysgol) (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2004

div.p: These Regulations amend the Education (Induction Arrangements for School Teachers) (Wales) Regulations 2003 (the 2003 Regulations).
Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Rheoliadau Addysg (Trefniadau Ymsefydlu ar gyfer Athrawon Ysgol) (Cymru) 2003 (Rheoliadau 2003).

entry.title: The Social Security (Basic Skills Training Pilot) Regulations 2004

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Social Security (Basic Skills Training Pilot) Regulations 2004

entry.summary: These Regulations establish a pilot scheme relating to persons who claim a jobseeker’s allowance and who fulfil the criteria specified in regulation 3 as to age, period over which they have been receiving benefit and the location of appropriate offices at which they claim benefit, as identified in the Schedule to these Regulations.

title.div: The Health and Social Care (Community Health and Standards) Act 2003 Commencement (No. 2) (Wales) Order 2004 / Gorchymyn Deddf Iechyd a Gofal Cymdeithasol (Iechyd Cymunedol a Safonau) 2003 Cychwyn (Rhif 2) (Cymru) 2004

div.p: This is the second commencement order made by the National Assembly for Wales under the Health and Social Care (Community Health and Standards) Act 2003 (“the Act”). It brings certain provisions of the Act connected to Wales into force on 1st April 2004.

Dyma'r ail orchymyn cychwyn y mae Cynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru wedi'i wneud o dan Ddeddf Iechyd a Gofal Cymdeithasol (Iechyd Cymunedol a Safonau) 2003 (“y Ddeddf”). Mae'n dwyn i rym ar 1 Ebrill 2004 ddarpariaethau penodol y Ddeddf mewn cysylltiad â Chymru.

entry.title: The Sexual Offences Act 2003 (Prescribed Police Stations) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations apply to England, Wales and Northern Ireland. Part 2 of the Sexual Offences Act 2003 (the “2003 Act”) re-enacts Part I of the Sex Offenders Act 1997 (the “1997 Act”), with modifications. These Regulations therefore replace with amendments the Sex Offenders (Notification Requirements) (Prescribed Police Stations) Regulations 2001 which were made under equivalent powers in the 1997 Act. The 2003 Act specifies that relevant offenders are subject to requirements to notify certain personal details to the police. Section 87(1) of the 2003 Act provides for such notifications to be given by attending any police station in a person’s local police area which is prescribed in regulations. “Local police area” is defined in section 88(3) of the 2003 Act. Under the 2003 Act, relevant offenders may attend a police station in their local area prescribed in these Regulations in order to fulfil their notification obligations. Their obligations are to supply an initial notification to police, notify them of changes in their notifiable details, to notify the police periodically after the initial notification, and to comply with notification requirements in respect of travel outside the United Kingdom.

title.div: The Local Authorities (Conduct of Referendums) (Wales) Regulations 2004 / Rheoliadau Awdurdodau Lleol (Cynnal Refferenda) (Cymru) 2004

div.p: These Regulations, which apply only in relation to Wales, make provision for the conduct of referendums to be held by virtue of regulations or an order made under any provision of Part II of the Local Government Act 2000 (“the 2000 Act”). The Regulations also prescribe certain forms for use at a referendum under the Welsh Language Act 1993.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn, sy'n ymwneud â Chymru'n unig, yn darparu ar gyfer cynnal refferenda a gynhelir yn rhinwedd rheoliadau neu orchymyn a wnaed dan unrhyw ddarpariaethau sydd yn Rhan II o Ddeddf Llywodraeth Leol 2000 (“Deddf 2000”). Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn hefyd yn pennu rhai ffurflenni rhagnodedig sydd i'w defnyddio mewn refferendwm dan Ddeddf yr Iaith Gymraeg 1993.

entry.title: The European Parliament (Representation) Act 2003 (Commencement No. 6) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 23rd March 2004, in the United Kingdom and Gibraltar, the provisions of the European Parliament (Representation) Act 2003 that have not previously been brought into force by earlier commencement Orders.

entry.title: The Warwickshire Ambulance Service National Health Service Trust (Change of Name) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order amends the Warwickshire Ambulance Service National Health Service Trust (Establishment) Order 1993.

entry.title: The Sexual Offences Act 2003 (Commencement) (Scotland) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 1st May 2004 those provisions of the Sexual Offences Act 2003 (“the 2003 Act”) that extend to Scotland in so far as they are not already in force. Sections 138 and 141 to 143 came into force on Royal Assent.

entry.title: The Public Appointments and Public Bodies etc. (Scotland) Act 2003 (Commencement No. 5) Order 2004
entry.summary: The Order brings into force, on 1st April 2004, section 4(d) of the Public Appointments and Public Bodies etc. (Scotland) Act 2003 which provides for the dissolution of the Scottish Medical Practices Committee. The Order also brings into force on that date those provisions of schedule 4 (miscellaneous provision) which make provision in connection with the dissolution of the Scottish Medical Practices Committee.

entry.title: The Health and Social Care (Community Health and Standards) Act 2003 Commencement (No. 2) (Amendment) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order corrects various errors in the Health and Social Care (Community Health and Standards) Act 2003 Commencement (No. 2) Order 2004. Article 2(1) brings section 174 of the Health and Social Care (Community Health and Standards) Act 2003 (“the 2003 Act”) fully into force on 1st April 2004. Article 2(2) makes provision for the Order to have the same extent as any enactment it commences subject to two exceptions. Article 2(3) amends article 6(2) of the Order which commences repeals set out in Schedule 14 to the 2003 Act. Article 2(4) makes transitional provision in relation to section 43C (indemnity cover) of the National Health Service Act 1977 and secondly, the repeal of words in section 43D(1) (supplementary lists) of that Act. Article 2(5) corrects a typing error. Article 2(6) corrects a typing error and makes further transitional provision in relation to the Water Industry Act 1991. Article 2(7) makes a saving in respect of the repeal of section 40(3) of the National Health Service (Primary Care) Act 1997 (interpretation) in so far as it relates to section 54 of the National Health Service Act 1977 and the sale of medical practices.

entry.title: The Representation of the People (Combination of Polls) (England and Wales) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations apply to England and Wales. They revoke and replace the Representation of the People Regulations 1986.

entry.title: The Sexual Offences Act 2003 (Prescribed Police Stations) (Scotland) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations extend to Scotland only.

entry.title: The General Medical Services and Personal Medical Services Transitional and Consequential Provisions Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order makes transitional and consequential provision arising from—

entry.title: The European Parliamentary Elections Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations apply to England, Wales, Scotland and Gibraltar. They revoke the European Parliamentary Elections Regulations 1999.

entry.title: The Animals and Animal Products (Import and Export) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and re-enact with changes the Animals and Animal Products (Import and Export) (England and Wales) Regulations 2000 (S.I. 2000/1673).

entry.title: The Income Tax (Pay As You Earn) (Amendment) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Income Tax (Pay As You Earn) Regulations 2003 (“the PAYE Regulations”) to provide a right of appeal against directions made under regulations 72 and 81 of those Regulations in relation to an amount of tax that an employer was required to deduct under the PAYE Regulations from a payment to an employee but failed to deduct.

entry.title: The Marketing and Use of Dangerous Substances (No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations give effect to European Parliament and Council Directive 2003/11/EC on pentabromodiphenyl ether and octabromodiphenyl ether (“the restricted substances”), which amends for the 24th time Council Directive 76/769/EEC relating to restrictions on the marketing and use of certain dangerous substances and preparations.

entry.title: Plant Protection Products Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and replace the Plant Protection Products Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1995 (S.R. 1995 No. 371).
